meanings.definition: Lack of reverence or respect for God or sacred things.
meanings.sent1: The village was shocked by the impieties committed in the church.
meanings.sent2: The impieties shown towards the holy relics were deeply offensive.
meanings.sent3: The impieties of the mischievous children playing near the altar caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her impieties were like a dark cloud hanging over the peaceful community.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his impieties were felt throughout the entire town.

meanings.definition: An act of disrespect or irreverence toward God or sacred things.
meanings.sent1: The king punished those guilty of committing impieties in the temple.
meanings.sent2: The impieties of the sacrilegious thieves angered the entire village.
meanings.sent3: The impieties of the pranksters were met with stern warnings from the elders.
meanings.sent4: His impieties were like a dagger through the heart of the devout community.
meanings.sent5: The impieties of the vandals left a stain on the sacred grounds.
